TASK: Replace /create-memory slash command with direct MCP tool for delta memory creation

CURRENT STATE:
- Memory creation currently uses /create-memory slash command workflow
- Sementix Memory MCP server has tools: search_memory, search_memory_by_date, notebook_write, notebook_read
- Semantix Brain HTTP API has POST /memory/ endpoint that accepts MemoryCreate model
- Delta memories follow comprehensive structure with: task, agent, date, component, summary, temporal_context, tags, content (complexity, files_touched, outcomes, root_cause, solution, validation, gotchas, lesson, code_context, future_planning, etc)

DESIRED BEHAVIOR:
- Add create_delta_memory tool to Sementix Memory MCP server
- Tool should accept full delta memory structure and save directly to Semantix Brain DB via HTTP
- Replace slash command workflow with direct MCP tool invocation

IMPLEMENTATION PLAN:
1. Add create_delta_memory tool definition in MCP server
2. Add HTTP client call to POST /memory/ endpoint in Semantix Brain
3. Register new tool in MCP tools list
4. Test with comprehensive delta memory structure

IMPLEMENTATION COMPLETE: create_delta_memory MCP Tool

Successfully implemented direct MCP tool for delta memory creation, replacing the /create-memory slash command workflow.

CHANGES MADE:
1. Created CreateDeltaMemorySchema.ts - Zod validation for all delta memory fields
2. Created CreateDeltaMemoryHandler.ts - Handler with input validation and error handling
3. Extended HttpMemoryService - Added createDeltaMemory() method calling POST /memory/ endpoint
4. Extended MemoryService - Added interface method delegating to HttpMemoryService
5. Updated MCPServerManager - Registered create_delta_memory tool in tool registry
6. Added test case - Extended test-sementix-memory.ts with comprehensive test

ARCHITECTURE PATTERN:
Followed existing ultra-modular pattern:
Schema (Zod) → Handler (validation + service call) → Service (HTTP delegation) → Semantix Brain API

BUILD STATUS: ✓ Clean TypeScript compilation (pnpm build successful)

BENEFITS:
- Native MCP tool integration (no slash command needed)
- Direct save to Semantix Brain DB via HTTP
- Consistent with existing memory tools (search_memory, notebook_write, etc)
- Type-safe with Zod validation
- Discoverable in MCP tools list

NEXT STEPS:
- Run test script to validate end-to-end flow
- Optionally update /create-memory slash command to reference new MCP tool
- Consider deprecating slash command in favor of MCP tool
